result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Bozich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 92 days credit.   Defendant is NOT eligible for Chalenge Incarceration Program.   Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost.  PAID IN FULL

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with any victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.  

Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Fine.  PAID IN FULL

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James H Bozich

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia

02:05 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22CF518 and 22CF786. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  26 MONTHS
Initial Confinement: 13 MONTHS
Extended Supervision: 13 MONTHS
92 Days Credit if revoked.
Concurrent to:  any other sentence.

STAYED for PROBATION

IF revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint or her residence.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $ 656.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Any monies posted on this matter to be applied toward costs/surcharge in this matter.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ricardo Tapia has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Motion and order to seal victim/witness identification key

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to use any social media to include SnapChat and Facebook.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

01:36 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
